meanings.definition: To freely transfer the possession of something to someone else.
meanings.sent1: I will give my toy to my friend.
meanings.sent2: Can you give me a pencil, please?
meanings.sent3: I will give my seat to the teddy bear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile can give warmth to a room.
meanings.sent5: The sun will give light to the garden.

meanings.sent1: She will give a speech at the event.
meanings.sent2: Please give this letter to your teacher.
meanings.sent3: The magician will give a rabbit to the audience.
meanings.sent4: His words can give hope to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The bell will give a signal for the start of class.

meanings.sent1: The store will give food to the shelter.
meanings.sent2: Can you give me directions to the park?
meanings.sent3: The tree will give shade to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her advice can give comfort to a troubled heart.
meanings.sent5: The clouds will give rain to the thirsty plants.

meanings.definition: To yield or produce a result.
meanings.sent1: Studying hard will give good grades.
meanings.sent2: Practice will give you better skills.
meanings.sent3: The recipe will give a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: Kindness can give happiness to others.
meanings.sent5: The effort will give success in the end.

meanings.definition: To perform an action or service.
meanings.sent1: He will give a speech at the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will give your car a check-up.
meanings.sent3: The robot will give a dance performance.
meanings.sent4: Her music can give joy to the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The doctor will give care to the patient.
